t:
â€œWell... Umm... You see, we've a tradition in our village. We don't tell outsiders about it.â€

â€œOkay, I understand.â€

â€œOur village is haunted by La Sollozante. Every sixth full moon of each year we need to sacrifice someone to keep our village and village people safe.â€

c:
â€œNow that's interesting. But I thought you weren't supposed to tell.â€

â€œSo every year we bring an outsider here. We need to explain to him what's happening before the ritual. This is important. Because you see, she doesn't feed on flesh, but on your fear.â€

â€œUmm... I don't think I like where this is going.â€

â€œI'm sorry, but you see, if she doesn't get her fill, she'll return early and take one of us. So please understand, there's nothing personal. Oh, and don't worry. We put a paralyzing agent in your coffee, you won't feel a thing.â€

â€œUm Oom Amm...â€ Maybe he's saying he's sorry, but that doesn't really matter.

â€œI think the coffee is taking effect. Yes, that's the fear. She'll feed well now.â€

â€œUrmm... Aaarmm,â€ and more incoherent mumbling.

â€œOh! Are you cursing, friend? You insisted on coming with me to my village. You wanted to get a taste of this small town. You wanted to go home with a story.
Well, these are our ways, but it is your story.

It is not our fault if you don't like how it ends.â€
